title: HTTP Strict Transport Security (HSTS) Policy Not Enabled

profile.name: joola.io
profile.about: joola is an open-source project that helps businesses embed advanced analytics and visualizations as part of their website.

vulnerability_information:
Dear Team,

Step-by-step instructions on how to reproduce the problem:

It was found the application is vulnerable to HTTP Strict Transport Security (HSTS) Policy Not Enabled.

HTTP Strict Transport Security (HSTS) is an opt-in security enhancement that is specified by a web application through the use of a special response header. Once a supported browser receives this header that browser will prevent any communications from being sent over HTTP to the specified domain and will instead send all communications over HTTPS. It also prevents HTTPS click through prompts on browsers.

activities.message:
Thanks for your submission!

joola.io is, as with other data system, must be running on SSL connections only **in production**. This is controlled by configuration and the instance you have been reviewing supports both HTTP and HTTPs by design and avoids HSTS. To expand on this, joola.io is designed for integration and does not have "a face" of its own. Therefore, HTTP/HTTPs and policy enforcement must be flexible to be configured by the operator.

I'm closing this ticket as won't fix, but your feedback is welcome and we can comment further on this thread.

The [joola](http://github.com/joola/joola.io) team.
